intro: Nolana mollis, commonly known as the silky nolana, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Nolana mollis is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
